Chinese: 喂，剛才那個……那是什麼東西啊？
German: Was war das für ein Ding?

English: It was Mr. Navit, wasn't it?

Maybe, but why would he be here? For a product
promotion?
Chinese:
好像是啦……為什麼會在這裡啊？
是來宣傳還是幹麼的嗎？
Korean:
뭐, 그럴지도 모르지만…… 왜 이런 곳에 있지?
프로모션이나 뭐 그런 건가?
German:
Kann sein, aber was hat er hier verloren? Macht er
Werbung für ein Produkt?

English:
Probably? He was so friendly, but didn't say a
word.
Chinese:
大概是吧？
很親切不是嗎，雖然一直不說話。
Korean:
그렇지 않을까?
무지 붙임성 있었잖아. 시종일관 아무 말 없었지만
German:
Wahrscheinlich. Er war so freundlich, aber er hat
kein Wort gesagt.

English: He was really drawn to you! It was hilarious!
Chinese: 他不是還一直纏著你嗎，超好笑的。哈哈！
German: Er war ganz vernarrt in dich! Das war urkomisch!

English:
He was so determined to shake your hand. And
wouldn't stop touching your body.
Chinese:
只有你被他握手握得緊緊的，
還有很多的身體接觸不是嗎？
Korean:
너한테만 묘할 정도로 끈적하게 악수했고
바디 터치도 격렬했지
German:
Er wollte dir unbedingt die Hand schütteln. Und
er hat nicht aufgehört, dich anzufassen.

English: And didn't he blow in your ear before he left?
Chinese: 好像在分開時還有對你的耳朵吹氣吧？
Korean: 뭔가 헤어질 때도 귀에 후~ 하지 않았냐?
German:
Und hat er dir nicht sogar ins Ohr gepustet, bevor
er gegangen ist?

English: Yeah, I took a photo. I'll post it on DigiLine!
Chinese: 我有拍下來，我要上傳到數碼連線上！
German:
Ja, ich habe ein Foto gemacht. Das poste ich auf
Digiline!

English: Don't even think about it! I'm serious!
Chinese: 別開玩笑了！　我說真的你們住手啦～
German: Denk nicht mal dran! Im Ernst!

English:
(It seems something resembling Mr. Navit had its
hands all over that good-looking guy.)
Chinese:
（看來，那個NAVIT好像對帥哥
　很執著地糾纏不放……）
Korean:
(……아무래도 미남에게
 내빗군과 닮은 무언가가 집요하게
 들러붙었다는 모양이다……)
German:
(Anscheinend hat etwas, was aussah wie Herr Navit,
diesen gut aussehenden Typen begrapscht.)

English: (Mr. Navit must be in Broadway somewhere.)
Korean:
(역시 이 BW 내에 "내빗씨"가 있는 건
 분명한 모양이군)
German:
(Navit-san muss sich irgendwo im Broadway
aufhalten.)

Korean: (좋아, 다시 한번 건물 안을 꼼꼼하게 찾아보자!)
